title: Mexican pageant challenges standard of beauty
description: Fighting against standards of appearance developed over decades, contestants’ skin tone in the Miss Colonia pageant is darker than that usually seen on stage in Mexico

title: Northern Egypt train derailment kills 2, injures 16
description: Egyptian authorities say a passenger train has derailed, killing at least two people

title: Chuck Jackson, soul balladeer, dies at 85
description: He recorded some of Burt Bacharach’s earliest compositions and influenced the styles of pop singer Tom Jones and Michael McDonald.

title: Lebanon, Gabon and South Sudan regain UN vote, not Venezuela
description: The president of the U.N. General Assembly has announced that Lebanon, Gabon and South Sudan made sufficient payments to restore their voting rights in the 193-member world body

title: Sudan general says military leaders clinging to power
description: A powerful paramilitary commander has slammed Sudan’s ruling generals, saying they oppose stepping down to allow for a democratic transition under a civilian administration

title: Video of alleged POW killing angers and inspires Ukrainians
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has called on Ukrainians to repeat the dead man’s patriotic final words: “Slavi Ukraini."

title: Russian gallery shows art by 'Merchant of Death' freed by US
description: Viktor Bout, a former Russian arms dealer who was released from a U.S. prison in a swap for WNBA star Brittney Griner in December, has unveiled an exhibition of his artworks in Moscow

title: Ukrainian refugees celebrate Purim in Berlin as war drags on
description: Hundreds of refugees from Ukraine have celebrated the Jewish holiday of Purim in Berlin dressed in colorful costumes and dancing to loud Israeli music

title: Caribbean sees jump in visitors since pandemic began
description: Officials say tourists flocked to the Caribbean last year in numbers not seen since the pandemic began, with the Dutch Caribbean and U.S. territories surpassing even pre-pandemic visitor arrivals

title: Mexico vows not to budge on US corn dispute
description: Mexico’s president has pledged not to back down in a dispute with the United States over a potential ban on imports of genetically modified corn

title: Argentina boosts security forces in violence-plagued Rosario
description: Argentina’s president says he will send hundreds more federal security forces to the central city of Rosario where drug violence has drawn international attention due to a recent threat against soccer superstar Lionel Messi

title: Kingsolver, O'Farrell among Women's Prize fiction contenders
description: Previous winners Barbara Kingsolver and Maggie O’Farrell are among contenders for the 30,000 pound ($36,000) Women’s Prize for Fiction

title: 'Oh my daughter': Volunteer medic, 29, buried in Ukraine
description: Just over a week ago, Associated Press journalists filmed 29-year-old Yana Rikhlitska as she helped treat wounded soldiers in a field hospital outside the city of Bakhmut in eastern Ukraine

title: Ukraine military identifies soldier seen in grisly war video
description: The Ukrainian military has tentatively identified as one of its missing soldiers a man who appeared to be shot dead by Russian-speakers in a short video

title: Leader of Belarus acknowledges attack on Russian warplane
description: The authoritarian leader of Belarus says an alleged Ukrainian saboteur and more than 20 accomplices have been detained over an attack on a Russian war plane stationed in his country

title: 2 kidnapped Americans found dead in Mexico, 2 others alive
description: A Mexican official says two U.S. citizens missing since their violent abduction last week in the northern Mexican border city of Matamoros have been found dead

title: Kidnapped Americans went to Mexico for medical procedure, families say
description: Latavia “Tay” McGee, Shaeed Woodard, Zindell Brown and Eric James Williams were abducted at gunpoint by unidentified assailants in Matamoros.

title: Bangladesh building explosion kills at least 14; scores hurt
description: An explosion in a seven-story commercial building in Bangladesh’s capital has killed at least 14 people and injured dozens

title: Pope renews cabinet of cardinal advisers, adds new members
description: Pope Francis has renewed his cabinet of cardinal advisers from around the world

title: Venezuelans still miss Chavez, want Maduro to do 'better'
description: President Hugo Chávez told Venezuelans to choose Nicolás Maduro as his successor during his last televised message before dying of cancer

title: Japan forced to explode own space rocket during launch
description: Japan's space agency was forced to destroy its flagship H3 rocket minutes after blastoff due to an ignition failure, in a blow to the country's space endeavors.

title: ‘Magnificent’ smiling sphinx of Roman emperor found at ancient Egypt site
description: The sphinx, probably modeled on the Roman emperor Claudius, was discovered in a tomb at the archaeological site of the temple of Dendera in Qena Province.

title: Roman shrine uncovered beneath graveyard in central England
description: Archaeologists have uncovered what they believe to be a Roman shrine beneath a former graveyard in the grounds of a cathedral in central England

title: 2 Italian air force planes collide mid-air, killing pilots
description: Two Italian air force planes collided in mid-air and crashed to the ground, killing both pilots

title: Teachers protest over suspected Iran schoolgirl poisonings
description: Iranian teachers have held protests in several cities over suspected poisonings targeting hundreds of schoolgirls

title: Vase is first evidence of a real gladiator fight in Roman Britain
description: Gladiators Memnon and Valentinus sparred almost 2,000 years ago. An analysis suggests that the fight took place in what is now Colchester, England.

title: Polish TV report: John Paul II knew of abuse as archbishop
description: A television news report says Pope St. John Paul II knew about sexual abuse of children by priests under his authority when he was an archbishop in his native Poland

title: Want to rein in Russian oligarchs? Target the wealth managers, study says.
description: Russian oligarchs use a network of offshore money managers to hide their wealth. Sanctions targeting them would have a high impact, according to new research.

title: Vatican, Greece ink deal for 'donation' of Parthenon Marbles
description: The Vatican and Greece are finalizing a deal for the return of three sculpture fragments from the Parthenon that have been in the collection of the Vatican Museums for two centuries

title: Malnutrition rises in pregnant women in 12 at-risk countries
description: A new United Nations report says acute malnutrition among pregnant and breastfeeding mothers has increased by 25% in the past two years in 12 countries hard hit by rising food prices fueled by the fighting in Ukraine

title: Israelis, Palestinians clash in flashpoint West Bank town
description: Israeli settlers and Palestinians have clashed in a flashpoint town in the occupied West Bank that was torched by settlers last week

title: Qatar's top diplomat is sworn in as new prime minister
description: Qatar’s top diplomat has been sworn in as the new prime minister, replacing another member of the ruling family who had held the post since 2020

title: Woman arrested in gruesome killing of Hong Kong model
description: Hong Kong police say a woman accused of assisting a suspect in the gruesome killing and dismemberment of model Abby Choi in Hong Kong has been arrested by mainland authorities

title: Settlers attack Palestinian town again amid Israeli Purim celebrations
description: Huwara, which was the scene of a rampage more than a week ago, was attacked again by Israeli settlers after sunset marked the start of the Purim holiday.

title: US defense secretary makes unannounced visit to Baghdad
description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin has made an unannounced visit to Baghdad just days before the 20th anniversary of the U.S.-led invasion that ousted Saddam Hussein

title: Cyclone Freddy to slam Mozambique Friday in rare second hit
description: Still recovering from the effects of the first battering, the southwestern African nation of Mozambique is bracing for a rare second hit by long-living Tropical Cyclone Freddy late on Friday night, a regional weather center said Tuesday

title: Striking French workers dispute that they want a ‘right to laziness’
description: French unions are bringing the country to a standstill because, despite generous perks, many employees are increasingly dissatisfied with working conditions.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Ukraine refuses to retreat from Bakhmut; China bristles against warning on arming Russia
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said his top commanders had unanimously decided to keep fighting for the embattled city.

title: China’s foreign minister predicts impending clash with United States
description: Qin Gang denied China had provided weapons to either side of the Ukraine conflict but warned China-Russia relations would strengthen if global turmoil continued.

title: Who is Estonia’s Kaja Kallas, and why is her election win key for Ukraine?
description: Prime Minister Kaja Kallas, one of the fiercest critics of Russian President Vladimir Putin, won a big election victory despite recession and high inflation.

title: The Rohingya fled genocide. Now, violence stalks them as refugees.
description: A visit to the camps at Cox's Bazar revealed that international and Bangladeshi agencies charged with protecting the Rohingya have failed to stem a surge in violence.

title: Gender equality is ‘300 years away,’ U.N. chief warns
description: U.N. Secretary General António Guterres said in a speech before International Women's Day that decades of advances on women’s rights are being wound back.

title: Putin retreats deeper into his labyrinth
description: For Russian President Vladimir Putin, conditions for any kind of victory remain elusive, but there’s no indication he is ready for real talks.
